name: Novotel Bangkok Suvarnabhumi Airport

reviews.text: Spent one night here with our daughter, and our son whom we hadn't seem for a year en route from London to Koh Samui. More character than most airport hotels, and the all you can eat and drink sushi certainly hit the mark for our family get together, as di happy hour around the pool.
reviews.title: Good for an overnight stay

reviews.text: Rooms are spacious and well furnished, although we could not get any hot water in the shower. I would certainly stay here again for an overnight stay without the hassle of travelling into Bangkok
reviews.title: A comfortable stay

reviews.text: Booked an Executive Room from the hotel's official website.
reviews.title: Fabulous Hotel, highly recomended

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The service at the hotel was good. Checking-in at the lounge was smooth and we were offered fresh juice. I was a bit hungry after my flight so i had some finger food at the lounge, however the choices were little for me since i do not eat deep-fried stuffs.
reviews.title: Great for early morning flight

reviews.text: Our room was clean and comfortable. The bathroom was spotless. The bathtub was big with a separate shower. Toiletries was hotel's own brand but the quality was not bad. Internet was free in the room and worked.
reviews.title: Distinctly average - Only stay here if you really need to be at the airport

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I love this hotel. We have stayed before when we have an early flight or arrive late and have always enjoyed it.It can be expensive, but I have always found it to be a very pleasant experience.This time, we stayed one night before a very early morning flight, arriving mid afternoon.Check in was quick and easy and our room was lovely.The bed was huge and extremely comfortable,the bathroom was large with a good sized bath and separate shower. There were ample toiletries, fruit and water.The gym is excellent and the pool is refreshing and beautiful with plenty of sun lounges, a delightful thai garden area, and giant beachtowels.There is even a swim up bar.I find it hard to believe I'm at an airport motel.There was an OTOP market setting up when we arrived and the stalls were varied and plentiful.We bought a lot of last minute goodies at prices as low as anywhere else and then enjoyed dinner in the buffet restaurant.The food here is excellent and plentiful, as is the service, and we had no complaints.The price for dinner was way less than we'd pay in Australia, so that's a bonus.After a very comfortable night's sleep, the only bad spot- and it's a biggie- was the chaos of the morning shuttles.Nowhere near enough of them operating and of course, someone always wants to come out last and jump in first. It was lucky there were no fisticuffs when many frustrated travellers had been waiting and waiting.This is possibly the most important thing at an airport hotel, and they failed miserably. Even though we woke up early and made sure we had ample time we were let down by the shuttle service.Luckily we were rushed through check in and just made our flight, no shopping time, lot's of running.So, all in all things turned out okay.I've slept on chairs at Suvarnabhumi Airport before and will always prefer the quiet and comfort of this hotel.Hopefully this was just a minor lapse and next time the shuttle service will be on top of things, because we will definitely return.
reviews.title: I love this hotel,.....but..

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here on our return leg of our trip to the southern hemisphere before departing for Krabi. The hotel facilities are excellent and the staff all wonderful. We only stayed one night but the room was wonderful and had everything you could imagine. Easy check in and out.
reviews.title: Excellent for stopovers

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just needed somewhere to sleep before heading to Hua Hin after getting in at 1am. It's location is fabulous with the shuttle. Rooms excellent too. Our only gripe was not offering even the usual 30 mins free public wifi that Accor offers at the other Accor hotels we have stayed at in the last 12 months. We went to Novotel in Hua HIn and had brilliant free wifi in our room 24/7.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel

reviews.text: Stayed here just for a night due to technical snag in Malaysia Airlines' aircraft. Upon being brought to the hotel, it felt the unexpected halt was not bad at all! Our last flight out of Bangkok for Kulala Lumpur was cancelled and we were shifted to first flight out the next morning.
reviews.title: Unplanned Transit stay, a pleasant one!
Upgrade to a club room
reviews.text: I was allotted a standard room on a floor that I suppose was dedicated for transit passengers in such situations as all fellow passengers were directed to the same floor.

The room was clean and much more than livable for the night. Had no chance to explore the hotel as I was tired when checking in and was supposed to check-out early morning by 4 to leave for the flight. Though breakfast coupons were given while checking-in, did not have a chance so rushed out straight for the airport shuttle.
reviews.title: Perfect overnighter

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: However, I must mention that the hotel made a mark in my mind if I have to remain close to Suvarnabhumi Airport anytime in future. For transit passengers, it could be the best option.
reviews.title: Great for Stop Over

reviews.text: Arrived in BKK at about 6:00pm for a 12 hour layover and a 6:00am flight. This hotel is really the only one that makes sense. The rooms are basic but clean, but I really love the shower. Our room was REALLY hot when we got in it, but the A/C worked well and it cooled down pretty quickly.
reviews.title: Bit better than it needs to be, but just a bit

reviews.text: We had dinner in the Thai restaurant, which is fine..
reviews.title: Location may justify the price

reviews.text: Really can't complain about anything it is exactly what I expected and what I need in an airport hotel...
reviews.title: Worked for what we needed.

reviews.text: Note the walkway is much faster than the shuttle if you don't have a ton of luggage, just go down to the train level and pass it you'll get there.
reviews.title: Great hotel for long airport layover

reviews.text: Would stay there again, but only with an early flight..
reviews.title: Fantastic Airport Hotel but Expensive

reviews.text: After arriving from the US at 11pm and an early morning flight to Koh Samui ahead of me, I needed a place to crash. The convenient complimentary shuttle to and from the airport makes this hands down the easiest option. You can easily find a cheaper and just as nice alternative in Bangkok if you're up for taking a taxi or the BTS, but for only 10 hours this made the most sense. Be prepared to raid the mini bar as there aren't many food options late at night and there is a charge for Internet. I foolishly thought the breakfast was included at the buffet but it will run you about $30 USD for the extravagant spread of both Western and Thai foods. The pool is great for an early morning swim and the room was spotless and spacious. I couldn't figure out the light switches and was so tired I just slept with the lights on, but I'm sure a hotel employee could have helped me out since the service was nothing but spot on during my stay.
reviews.title: one night only

reviews.text: Stayed here for a 12 hour transit with two small kids.
reviews.title: Best transit ever
Nice airport hotel
reviews.text: Nothing but outstanding service, brilliant helpful staff. Amazing dinner buffet, decent play corner, beautiful pool area to relax between flights.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Clean room, all we could ask for. only frustration was air con too cold and I was too jetlagged to bother trying to figure out if they could change my settings, couldn't find an obvious way to do it myself.
reviews.title: Ideal place for a stopover

reviews.text: I had minimal time here on a stop over. I walked from the airport along the B1 concourse and that was easy enough and I got the shuttle back - the recommended option! The check in was very busy but they quickly got more clerks out to deal with the queue. The check in clerk could have been friendly or at least made eye contact but I guess when you are busy that is not always a luxury. It was a bit of a hike to the room and the room was a little dark but well apportioned. The bed was huge, and comfy and although the decor was a little tried it eas a perfectly plesant place to spend 8 hours between flights.
reviews.title: Thailand Trip 2013

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: By far the best transit hotel I have ever stayed in.
reviews.title: Excellent Transit Hotel with Lovely Pool
18 hour stopover
reviews.text: Very quiet and tastefully appointed room. The pool was lovely Thai Lanna Style very relaxing after along Flight. The staff very helpful.
If you do not have lots of luggage you can walk from the main terminal via the railway station. About 3 minutes walk. this will save you getting the shuttle bus.
reviews.title: Great airport hotel.
Good value airport hotel
reviews.text: Expensive as hotels go in Bangkok I think, but very convenient when you want somewhere comfortable to spend the day, do some work, have a swim, get something to eat before your onward flight.
Despite the floods in Bangkok, the hotel is keeping its level of service and food up to its usual standards.
reviews.title: Nice but overpriced

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel is a good standard for Novotel Brand and for Airport Hotel.
reviews.title: Good for Airport Hotel

reviews.text: Good location with very easy and frequent transfers to/from airport and easy to find
reviews.title: Strange check out
Extremely Nice Hotel
reviews.text: Lobby of hotel impressive .

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Several restaurants in lobby appeared (didn't eat at any of them) very nice. And offered variety
reviews.title: Good for a transit night
Nice stay
reviews.text: Stayed here 1 night because of an early flight next morning. Posh/clean room. Very helpful staff.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Only negative is it took them a while to get my luggage up to the room, I thought it'd be in my room ahead of me since they took it as soon as I arrived & before I checked in. By the time I called to check on my luggage it arrived 2 minutes later. Makes a difference if you have less than a day left to spend in Bangkok.
reviews.title: at the airport

reviews.text: You can't get much closer to the airport and that is the appeal. If you walk out the "back door" there is a tunnel leading to the light rail system and directly into the airport. This worked well for us because we had a very early flight, and due to the flooding we were concerend about traveling across town to our "real hotel" -- KT guest house. The hotel is a western style hotel with all the ammenities you would expect, and a price to match -- not much to add to any review other than to say it is an "airport hotel". The pool was a great retreat after taking the light rail down to the "real Bangkok". The food was OK, but pricey. If you walk the underground walkway to the airport you will find a "food court" called Magic on the first floor of the airport. It looks like it is a haven for the airport employees and locals alike. There are dozens of choices from dim sum to pork neck and the quality is really wonderful -- and the price...I had a wonderul dinner for $150 baht! don't go there for the atmosphere, but if you want good cheap food...
reviews.title: Such a Treat!

reviews.text: Traveled to BKK with my sister and stayed at a cheap hotel that said it was "at the airport"..but it was not. So, we decided to check in to Novotel Suvanabhumi and we were preasently surpried! It was absolutley gorgeous! The room service was amazing and the staff was GREAT! I ended up staying there again 4 months later. I had a night flight to LA thus i needed a late checkout- and they were more than happy to acomodate me- free of charge. Also, the staff who served the room service were so kind. I went to the spa 2 times, and it was great! Between the hot tea before the service, the kind staff, and the great spa treatments it was amazing!
reviews.title: Repeat Customer

reviews.text: Furthermore, my sister and I wanted to go into Bangkok so the concierge arranged a car for us and drew out a map of where we would go and told the driver--and told us to call the hotel if we had any problems while out and about in Bangkok--Cant beat that!
reviews.title: disappointing

reviews.text: Location to airport - you can walk in less than 10 minutes - excellent. (We were met and driven to hotel as part of their service).
reviews.title: <24 hr stopover stay

reviews.text: Service by hotel staff was second to none.
reviews.title: A great en-route rest!

reviews.text: I would recommend this hotel/airport as a terrific stopover/step before moving onto to anywhere in Europe/America if flying from anywhere in Australia.
reviews.title: Good for a one night stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great way to refresh yourself and help avoid too much jet lag.
reviews.title: Exactly what we need whilst in transit at Bangkok!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we booked we thought it was a little pricey for a <24hr stopover but we quickly changed our minds following excellent service and fabulous polite and courteous staff. We would definitely stay again.
reviews.title: Great airport hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed overnight as part of flight delays and rerouting, arrived well after midnight, and room service produced very nice lasagne.
reviews.title: CONVENIENT FOR AIRPORT

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Pleasant room, everything worked, but this is yet another hotel where the bathroom isn't totally private - there's a bamboo blind covering a glass panel into the bedroom, so if you're in bed you've got some of the light from the bathroom coming through.
reviews.title: Great Airport Hotel

reviews.text: Very quick checkout, and transfer to the airport. As airport hotels go this is a recommendable option.
reviews.title: Could have been much better.

reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel less than 24h (arriving in the afternoon and heading out the next early morning) and were pleasantly surprised by the hotel facilities, services and food quality which is better than what we have encountered in other Novotels or other airport hotels. The Hotel's lobby form delighting oasis withing the commotion of the airport terminal. The room (superior) was spacious, spotless and welcoming. We had both dinner and breakfast at the hotel. Both were very good and offered good value for money. Don't hesitate to book an overnighter here. Little drawback... no free wifi.
reviews.title: Good - But Expensive

reviews.text: Shuttle to and from airport was excellent. The front desk is situated at the opposite side of the hotel from the entrance, so a bit far. Check in was smooth. The room was quite nice and reasonably appointed. The internet price is steep compared to other hotels. The Atrium Terrace Bar had good entertainment, the snack was good, service could have been more attentive and drinks a little pricey. Slept well and the morning tea was good. The breakfast buffet was extensive, but too much bacon precooked so a little greasy, same with fried eggs and the sausages were not to my taste. Service was also spotty, one server was excellent the other lousy. I spent all day outside at the pool area, the design very good for short stay hotel. The swim up bar was very good, but they were out of draft beer and the bartenders were more interested in talking about their nights activities and also checking some sales magazine. I went for dinner at Sala Thai, I had a couple of Thai dishes which were acceptable but nothing to write home about. I had a bit of a restless night, baby crying, not the hotels fault, but in the morning I found the bath towel was ripped and there was a shortage of toilet paper.
reviews.title: Best possible location for evening before a long flight

reviews.text: Hotel is a 2 minute ride from baggage claim. There is a shuttle on the taxi level: as you come out of baggage claim take a right and walk almost to the end of the building. There are numerous kiosks and taxi stands inside and you will be asked by everyone to stop and take advantage of their services. Don't stop! Continue walking until you find the Novotel stand. They will confirm your reservation and quickly take you to the hotel.
reviews.title: Great layover hotel

reviews.text: Once you get there you'll notice the lobby area is very large. There is a bar on the left that closes at midnight and a restaurant on the right that stays open 24 hours (at least limited services, anyway). Keep walking and eventually you'll get to the reception desk (it is a bit confusing and people are always asking where to check in). Rooms are nice and I've heard the gym and poll are nice as well, although I've never used them.
reviews.title: My stay in March 2013

reviews.text: You can actually walk to/from airport if you'd like. Walk passed reception desk and go downstairs. Here you can catch train into the city or walk under the street back to the airport. The last trains run at midnight so if you're out in the city later you'll have to get a taxi back to Novotel.
reviews.title: Steps from the airport, Great for families

reviews.text: There is a good breakfast buffet for about $22. It's a bit pricy but I guess it's worth the cost if you're hungry.
reviews.title: BKK airport hotel

reviews.text: standard novotel fare
reviews.title: decent airport hotel,fairly overpriced

situated in the hotel complex and has an airport shuttle evry half hour or so which is a great plus
reviews.title: Great hotel for the airport

reviews.title: Best Hotel I've ever been at!

reviews.title: The best stop over hotel ever

aka: Novotel Suvarnabhumi Airport Hotel Racha Thewa
description: The Novotel Suvarnabhumi Airport is a 4 star hotel located 10 min walk from Suvarnabhumi International Airport in Bangkok. Ideal for business trips, the hotel features 5 boardrooms, a pillarless grand ballroom for up to 1,000 people, plus 6 meeting and function rooms and a business centre. Boasting 612 comfortable and contemporary rooms, the hotel also offers 2 bars and 4 restaurants. With a 24 hr airport shuttle every 10 min from Gate 4 Level 2 and parking available, there is no better place to stay.
